Watch.Name: Clock watch
Watch.Description: Range is 99 down to 0 as an int

Watch.Name: Main menu
Watch.Description: The option selected in the main menu

Watch.Name: P1 Health
Watch.Description: Player 1 health as int. Range is approx 13000 down to 0.

Watch.Name: P2 Health
Watch.Description: Player 2 health as int. Range is approx 13000 down to 0.

Watch.Name: P1 Barrier
Watch.Description: Player 1's barrier guage as int. Range is 10000 to 0.

Watch.Name: P2 Barrier
Watch.Description: Player 2's barrier guage as int. Range is 10000 to 0.

Watch.Name: P1 Special
Watch.Description: Player 1's special guage as an int. Range is 10000 to 0.

Watch.Name: P2 Special
Watch.Description: Player 2's special guage as an int. Range is 10000 to 0.

Watch.Name: P1 Character Selected
Watch.Description: Which character is selected as int. Range is 18 down to 0.

Watch.Name: P2 Character Selected
Watch.Description: Which character is selected as int. Range is 18 down to 0.

Watch.Name: Pause menu options
Watch.Description: Pause menu options as int in range 0 to 4

Watch.Name: Quit to main menu confirmation
Watch.Description: OK / Cancel options as ints 0 and 1 respectively.

Watch.Name: Options Menu
Watch.Description: Options menu options as in in range 0 to 7

Watch.Name: Sound and Language Menu Options
Watch.Description: Submenu options as an in in range 0 to 6

Watch.Name: Background Music Volume
Watch.Description: Music volume as an in in range 0 to 100

Watch.Name: Voice Volume
Watch.Description: Voice volume as an int in range 0 to 100

Watch.Name: Sound Effects Volume
Watch.Description: SFX volume as an int in range 0 to 100

Watch.Name: Voice Language
Watch.Description: Voice language as an int. 0 is Japanese, 1 is English.

Watch.Name: Text Language
Watch.Description: Text language as an int. 0 is J, 1 is E, 2 is Chinese, 3 is Korean.

Watch.Name: Player 1 Keyboard 1 Buttons Menu Options
Watch.Description: Buttons bindings as int. Range is 0 through 16.

Watch.Name: Controller 1 Change
Watch.Description: P1 controller as an int. 0 is keyboard 1 and 1 is controller 1.

Watch.Name: Player 1 Controller 1 Buttons Menu Options
Watch.Description: P1 button bindings for controller 1 as int in range 0 to 12.

Watch.Name: Game Options Menu Selected Option
Watch.Description: Selection as an in in range 0 to 8.

Watch.Name: Game Difficulty
Watch.Description: Game difficulty as an int in range 0 (beginner) to 5 (hell)

Watch.Name: Number of Rounds (Arcade)
Watch.Description: Number of rounds as int from 0 (1 round) to 4 (5 rounds) to win.

Watch.Name: Number of Rounds (Versus)
Watch.Description: Number of rounds as int from 0 (1 round) to 4 (5 rounds) to win.

Watch.Name: Time Limit (Arcade)
Watch.Description: Time limit setting as an int in range 0 (30 secs) to 5 (infinite).

Watch.Name: Time Limit (Versus)
Watch.Description: Time limit setting as an int in range 0 (30 secs) to 5 (infinite).

Watch.Name: System Voice
Watch.Description: System voice selection as int in range 5, 7-20 inclusive.

Watch.Name: Astral Heat BGM Setting
Watch.Description: Whether to play the Astral Heat background music (1) or not (0).

Watch.Name: Display Settings Menu
Watch.Description: Selected option as an int in range 0 to 8.

Watch.Name: Display FPS Setting
Watch.Description: Integer. Either 0 for off or 1 for on.

Watch.Name: Light Bloom Effect Setting
Watch.Description: An int. 1 if OFF and 0 is ON for this (e.g. they're swapped!)

Watch.Name: Anti-aliasing Setting
Watch.Description: Int. Goes 0 for 4x, 1 for 2x, 2 for off.

Watch.Name: Upper HUD Offset value
Watch.Description: Int in range +50 to -50.

Watch.Name: Lower HUD Offset value
Watch.Description: Int in range +50 to -50.

Watch.Name: Resolution setting
Watch.Description: Int in the range 0 through 5 (windows) 0 through 13 fullscreen.

Watch.Name: Windows / Fullscreen Mode
Watch.Description: Int. 1 is windowed, 0 is fullscreen.

Trigger.Name: Clock trigger
Trigger.Description: Monitors the game clock which controls in-game / in-menu

Trigger.Name: Clock 50 / Half-time
Trigger.Description: Lets you know the round is half way through

Trigger.Name: Clock 25
Trigger.Description: Lets you know the round timer has 25 seconds left

Trigger.Name: Clock 10
Trigger.Description: Lets you know the round is nearly over

Trigger.Name: P1 5000 health
Trigger.Description: Player 1's health gets to 5000

Trigger.Name: P1 1000 health
Trigger.Description: Player 1's health gets to 1000

Trigger.Name: P2 5000 health
Trigger.Description: Player 2's health gets to 5000

Trigger.Name: P2 1000 health
Trigger.Description: Player 2's health gets to 1000

Trigger.Name: P1 Barrier Full
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's barrier guage is full.

Trigger.Name: P1 Barrier Half (Falling)
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's barrier guage depletes to half.

Trigger.Name: P1 Barrier Half (Rising)
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's barrier guage rises to half.

Trigger.Name: P1 Barrier Gone
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's barrier guage is completely empty.

Trigger.Name: P2 Barrier Full
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's barrier guage is full.

Trigger.Name: P2 Barrier Half (Falling)
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's barrier guage depletes to half.

Trigger.Name: P2 Barrier Half (Rising)
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's barrier guage rises to half.

Trigger.Name: P2 Barrier Gone
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's barrier guage is completely empty.

Trigger.Name: P1 Special Half
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's special guage is half full.

Trigger.Name: P1 Special Full
Trigger.Description: Says when player 1's special guage is full.

Trigger.Name: P2 Special Half
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's special guage is half full.

Trigger.Name: P2 Special Full
Trigger.Description: Says when player 2's special guage is full.

GameConfig.Description:
Please note that if you're using the NVDA screen reader and use a keyboard to play this game then in-game trigger announcements will be cut short or even skipped entirely when a key is pressed - this is simply how NVDA operates. As such, it is advised to use a joypad or joystick to play the game which will mitigate this issue.
Also, the in-game sound effects are quite loud in this game - so to hear the sonification events via your screen reader it would be best to decrease the game audio output levels from the main menu's options menu.
You can find frame data for the characters here: http://www.dustloop.com/wiki/index.php/BBCSE/Frame_Data
Al Lansley 2018-11-14
